titleStmt.title: The merry boys of Europe. No liquor like the brisk canary, it makes the dull soul blith and merry; it helps the back, prolongs the life, and is much better then a wife. To the tune of, Now, now the fight's done, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Clarke, at the Horse-shooe, in West-smith-field, between the Hospital-Gate and Duck-Lane end.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "I'le drink of my bottle each night for my share,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Horse-shooe, in West-smith-field, between the Hospital-Gate
